Nim bindings for ndarray-c library

A numpy-like ndarray library for C with multi-dimensional arrays, OpenMP parallelization, and BLAS-optimized operations.

Features automatic memory management using Nim's destructors and move semantics.

Examples

Basic usage:

import ndarray

# Create a 2x3 array of ones (simple int syntax)
let arr = newOnes(@[2, 3])

# Set value at position (1, 2)
arr.set(@[1, 2], 42.0)

# Get value at position
let val = arr.get(@[1, 2])

# Print the array
arr.print("My Array", 2)

# No manual cleanup needed - automatic memory management!

Note: You can use regular int arrays (@[2, 3]) or csize_t arrays (@[2.csize_t, 3]) - both work!

Types

AggrType = enum
  aggrSum = 0, aggrMean = 1, aggrStd = 2, aggrMax = 3, aggrMin = 4
Aggregation types 
NDArray = object
A handle to a ndarray structure with automatic memory management

Consts

ALL_AXES = -1
Constant to indicate operations on all axes

Procs

proc abs(arr: NDArray) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Absolute value (modifies arr in place) 
proc add(arr: NDArray; other: NDArray): NDArray {.discardable, ...raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Element-wise addition (modifies arr in place) 
proc addScalar(arr: NDArray; scalar: cdouble): NDArray {.discardable,
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Add scalar (modifies arr in place) 
proc axpby(arr: NDArray; alpha: cdouble; other: NDArray; beta: cdouble): NDArray {.
    discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Linear combination: arr = alphaarr + betaother 
proc clip(arr: NDArray; minVal: cdouble; maxVal: cdouble) {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Clip values to range [minVal, maxVal]

    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Clip values above maximum threshold 
proc clipMin(arr: NDArray; minVal: cdouble): NDArray {.discardable, ...raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Clip values below minimum threshold 
proc copy(arr: NDArray): NDArray {....raises: [ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Create a copy of the array

               dstAxis: cint; dstIdx: csize_t) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Copy a slice from one array to another 
proc fillSlice(arr: NDArray; axis: cint; index: csize_t; value: cdouble) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Fill a slice with a scalar value 
proc free(arr: NDArray) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Manually free the ndarray (for manual memory management) Note: With automatic memory management, this is not needed as arrays are freed automatically when they go out of scope via the =destroy hook 
proc gemv(arr: NDArray; x: NDArray; alpha: cdouble; beta: cdouble; y: NDArray) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Matrix-vector multiply: y = alpha * arr * x + beta * y

    tags: [], forbids: [].}

    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

    forbids: [].}

proc mapFn(arr: NDArray; fn: proc (x: cdouble): cdouble {.cdecl.}): NDArray {.
    discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Apply function to each element in place 
proc mapMul(arr: NDArray; fn: proc (x: cdouble): cdouble {.cdecl.};
            other: NDArray; alpha: cdouble) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Map function then multiply: arr = func(arr) * other * alpha 
proc mul(arr: NDArray; other: NDArray): NDArray {.discardable, ...raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Element-wise multiplication (modifies arr in place) 
proc mulAdd(arr: NDArray; other: NDArray; dest: NDArray; alpha: cdouble;
            beta: cdouble) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Fused multiply-add: dest = alpha * (arr * other) + beta * dest 
proc mulScalar(arr: NDArray; scalar: cdouble): NDArray {.discardable,
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Multiply by scalar (modifies arr in place)

    discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Element-wise multiply then scale: arr = arr * other * scalar
